title: Introduction
content: I'm Ahmad Hassan, a Software Engineer and Full Stack Developer from Pakistan. I currently work at VieroMind and study at MNS University of Agriculture, Multan. I build web applications, contribute to open source, and write about things I learn along the way. My portfolio is at itsahmad.vercel.app.

title: What I Do
content: I work primarily with TypeScript, Next.js, and Golang on the frontend and backend, with cloud infrastructure on AWS. My day-to-day involves building full-stack applications, designing system architecture, and shipping products from idea to deployment.

title: Open Source & Community
content: Open source is something I genuinely care about. I've made 2,000+ contributions on GitHub in 2025 alone, and I try to build tools that are useful to others. HyprFlux started as my personal dotfiles and turned into something the Linux community actually uses daily with over 800+ stars on GitHub.

title: Competitive Programming
content: I enjoy competitive programming. I've solved 400+ problems on LeetCode and GeeksforGeeks, ranked #92 worldwide and #2 in Pakistan at UC Berkeley's CALICO Spring '25 competition, and picked up a few wins at national-level hackathons and programming contests.

title: Writing & Blog
content: I write technical blogs covering system design, AWS cloud, web development, databases, shell scripting, and occasionally personal topics. I started writing because it helps me think more clearly about what I'm learning, and if it helps someone else along the way, even better. My blog is available at /posts/.

title: Beyond Code
content: I'm an Arch Linux user running a Hyprland setup. I like my tools fast, minimal, and keyboard-driven. Neovim is my primary editor, Zsh is my shell, and I try to keep things distraction-free. When I'm not coding, I'm usually reading about productivity and self-improvement, customizing my Linux desktop, or exploring new tech.

title: Contact Information
content: You can reach me at: Email: ahmadhassan9059@gmail.com, LinkedIn: linkedin.com/in/ahmad9059, GitHub: github.com/ahmad9059, LeetCode: leetcode.com/u/ahmad9059, Instagram: instagram.com/ahmad9059.dev. My portfolio website is at itsahmad.vercel.app.

title: Technical Skills & Stack
content: My primary tech stack includes: Languages: TypeScript, JavaScript, Python, Golang, SQL, Shell scripting. Frontend: React, Next.js, Tailwind CSS, shadcn/ui, Framer Motion, GSAP. Backend: Next.js API routes, Golang, Node.js. Databases: PostgreSQL, MySQL, Supabase, Firebase, Redis. ORMs: Prisma. Cloud: AWS (Certified Cloud Practitioner), Google Cloud. DevOps: Git, GitHub, Docker, Vercel. AI/ML: Google Gemini, Google Genkit, Firebase Genkit. Authentication: Better Auth, Firebase Auth.

title: HyprFlux
content: HyprFlux is my most popular project with 800+ GitHub stars. It's a collection of dotfiles and configs for a beautiful, efficient Hyprland desktop on Arch Linux. It's minimal, productive, and fast. Built with Linux, Arch Linux, Hyprland, Waybar, Shell, and CSS. The project has its own website at hyprflux.dev. GitHub: github.com/ahmad9059/HyprFlux

title: SehatScan
content: SehatScan is an AI-powered health assessment platform that analyzes medical documents and facial images to generate personalized health insights. Built with Python, Next.js, TypeScript, AWS, Redis, PostgreSQL, Prisma, and Google Gemini. Live at sehatscan.vercel.app. GitHub: github.com/ahmad9059/SehatScan

title: HisaabScore
content: HisaabScore is an AI-powered alternative credit scoring system for gig workers and informal economy workers lacking traditional credit history. Built with TypeScript, Next.js, Tailwind CSS, Firebase, Google Genkit, Gemini 2.0, and Prisma. Live at hisaabscore.vercel.app. GitHub: github.com/ahmad9059/HisaabScore

title: RAF-SP
content: RAF-SP is an agricultural data management platform with department management, equipment tracking, and maintenance logs. Built with TypeScript, Next.js, Tailwind CSS, Prisma, Supabase, shadcn/ui, and Framer Motion. Live at raf-sp.vercel.app.

title: UAM Tracker
content: UAM Tracker is a full-stack GPA/CGPA tracker for UAM University students with authenticated dashboards and interactive progress charts. Built with TypeScript, Next.js, Tailwind CSS, Prisma, PostgreSQL, Better Auth, and Recharts. Live at uam-tracker.vercel.app. GitHub: github.com/ahmad9059/UamTracker

title: MindOasis
content: MindOasis is a hackathon project that helps users in Pakistan find mental health professionals with AI-powered profile summaries. Built with TypeScript, Next.js, Tailwind CSS, shadcn/ui, Firebase Genkit, and Google Gemini. Live at mindoasis.vercel.app. GitHub: github.com/ahmad9059/MindOasis

title: CodingHawks
content: CodingHawks is the official website for the Coding Hawks Society at MNS University of Agriculture (MNS-UoA), empowering coders through projects, learning, and competitions. Built with TypeScript, Next.js, Tailwind CSS, Prisma, Supabase, and shadcn/ui. Live at codinghawks.vercel.app. GitHub: github.com/ahmad9059/codinghawks

title: Operating System and Desktop
content: I use Arch Linux as my operating system because it's minimal, customizable, and gets out of my way. My window manager is Hyprland (Wayland-based tiling WM) with Waybar as my status bar. I use Tofi as my application launcher and power menu.

title: Terminal and Shell
content: I use foot as my terminal emulator for its speed and Wayland support. My shell is Zsh with syntax highlighting and auto-completion plugins. For file management in the terminal, I use Yazi which is fast and supports image previews.

title: Code Editors
content: Neovim is my primary code editor. I like my tools fast, minimal, and keyboard-driven. VSCodium is my secondary editor (VS Code without Microsoft telemetry) for when I need to show code to others.

title: Applications and Software
content: I use Thorium as my web browser (Chromium-based, fast, no telemetry) with uBlock Origin and Vimium extensions. For notes I use Obsidian, for reading books Foliate, for messaging 64gram (Telegram), for office work WPS Office, and for email Thunderbird.

title: Theme and Aesthetics
content: I use Tokyo Night and Catppuccin color schemes for my setup. My terminal font is JetBrains Mono with Nerd Font icons. I prefer a minimal, distraction-free aesthetic.

title: Portfolio Website
content: This portfolio website is built with Hugo static site generator and the PaperMod theme. Hugo outputs plain HTML and CSS, keeping things fast and lightweight. The site is deployed on Vercel at itsahmad.vercel.app. I write my blog posts in Obsidian and sync them to Hugo using a custom shell script.

title: Education
content: I am currently studying at MNS University of Agriculture, Multan, Pakistan. I'm pursuing my degree while working as a Software Engineer at VieroMind.

title: Projects Overview
content: I have 7 main projects on my portfolio: 1) HyprFlux (800+ stars, Hyprland dotfiles for Arch Linux, hyprflux.dev), 2) SehatScan (AI health assessment with medical document analysis, sehatscan.vercel.app), 3) HisaabScore (AI credit scoring for gig workers, hisaabscore.vercel.app), 4) RAF-SP (agricultural data management, raf-sp.vercel.app), 5) UAM Tracker (GPA/CGPA tracker, uam-tracker.vercel.app), 6) MindOasis (mental health professional finder, mindoasis.vercel.app), 7) CodingHawks (coding society website, codinghawks.vercel.app). Most are built with TypeScript, Next.js, and Tailwind CSS. Several use AI (Google Gemini) and databases (PostgreSQL, Supabase, Firebase).

title: Certifications Overview
content: I hold 21 certifications from organizations including Amazon Web Services (AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner, Intro to Generative AI), Meta (Front-End Developer Professional Certificate, JavaScript, MySQL, Databases), Google (Cloud Digital Leader, Agile Project Management, Python, Git, Data), GitHub (GitHub Foundations), HackerRank (SQL Intermediate, Problem Solving Intermediate), Harvard (CS50x Puzzle Day 2025), UC Berkeley (CALICO Spring '25), IBM (DevOps, Software Engineering, Critical Thinking), UC Davis (Critical Thinking), and DeepLearning.AI (AI For Everyone). My certifications span cloud, frontend, databases, AI, DevOps, and problem-solving.

title: Achievements Overview
content: My key achievements include: Ranked #92 globally and #2 in Pakistan at UC Berkeley's CALICO Spring '25, 2000+ GitHub contributions in 2025, HyprFlux reaching 800+ stars, full-time job offer at VieroMind, 2nd place at Pakathon (nationwide hackathon), 1st place at Maktab-e-Gulab Programming Competition, 1st place at Ignite Cybersecurity Workshop, 3rd place in Speed Programming at ACM-W at Air University, and 400+ problems solved on LeetCode and GeeksforGeeks.

title: Tools & Setup Overview
content: My development setup: Arch Linux OS with Hyprland (tiling WM), Waybar, and Tofi launcher. Terminal: foot with Zsh shell and Yazi file manager. Editors: Neovim (primary, keyboard-driven) and VSCodium (secondary). Browser: Thorium with uBlock Origin and Vimium. Notes: Obsidian. Theme: Tokyo Night / Catppuccin with JetBrains Mono font. Everything is minimal, fast, and distraction-free. My HyprFlux project (800+ stars) packages this entire setup.
